VLIB_aFast_nonmaxSuppression

Detailed Description


Functions

uint16_t VLIB_aFast_nonmaxSuppression (const uint8_t score[restrict], uint32_t posyxPkd[restrict], uint8_t scoreOut[restrict], uint32_t posyxPkdOut[restrict], uint16_t inNumScores, uint16_t imgWidth, uint16_t imgHeight, uint8_t scratch[restrict])

Function Documentation

uint16_t VLIB_aFast_nonmaxSuppression ( const uint8_t  score[restrict],
uint32_t  posyxPkd[restrict],
uint8_t  scoreOut[restrict],
uint32_t  posyxPkdOut[restrict],
uint16_t  inNumScores,
uint16_t  imgWidth,
uint16_t  imgHeight,
uint8_t  scratch[restrict] 
)

Description:
This function performs sparse non-maximum suppression. It finds those features that are local maxima based on the fast score, and places them at the beginning of the list.
Parameters:
[in] *score The input score list of feature points on which NMS has to be applied.
[in,out] *posyxPkd Location of feature points in packed 32 bit format where lower 16 bit is x co-ordinate and higher 16 bit is y co-ordinate. There should be one to one correspondence between score and posyxPkd. Also all feature points are in raster scan order.
[out] *scoreOut Output scores of feature points after non maxima supression.
[out] *posyxPkdOut Output location for non maxima supressed feature points. Format of this is same as posyxPkd. There will one to one correspondence between scoreOut and posyxPkdOut.
[in] inNumScores Total number of input feature points.
[in] imgWidth Input image width in pixels.
[in] imgHeight Input image height in pixels.
[in] scratch Input scratch memory area needed by this kernel. Size of this should be inNumScores * 2 + \ imgWidth *4 + 16
Returns:
This kernel returns total number of valid scores. Kernel returns '0' if any invalid parameter is passed to the kernel.
Assumptions:
  • scratch should be double word aligned.
  • posyxPkd and posyxPkdOut should be word aligned.
  • inNumScores should be multiple of 4.
Implementation Notes:
  • This code is compatible with C6XXX fixed point processors.
Benchmarks:
See VLIB_Test_Report.html for cycle and memory information.
